00053 //************************************************************************
00054 //
00055 //     InitializeFileDatabase():  Call this function to initialize the file
00056 //    database.  It will use the gGameLibaries[] array for the list of libraries
00057 //    and the define NUMBER_OF_LIBRARIES for the number of libraries.  The gGameLibaries
00058 //    array is an array of structure, one of the fields determines if the library
00059 //    will be initialized and game start.
00060 //
00061 //************************************************************************
00062 BOOLEAN InitializeFileDatabase( )
00063 {
00064       INT16             i;
00065       UINT32            uiSize;
00066       BOOLEAN           fLibraryInited = FALSE;
00067 
00068 #ifdef JA2
00069       GetCDLocation( );
00070 #else
00071       gzCdDirectory[ 0 ] = '.';
00072 #endif
00073 
00074       //if all the libraries exist, set them up
00075       gFileDataBase.usNumberOfLibraries = NUMBER_OF_LIBRARIES;
00076 
00077       //allocate memory for the each of the library headers
00078       uiSize = NUMBER_OF_LIBRARIES * sizeof( LibraryHeaderStruct );
00079       if( uiSize )
00080       { 
00081             gFileDataBase.pLibraries = (LibraryHeaderStruct *) MemAlloc( uiSize );
00082             CHECKF( gFileDataBase.pLibraries );
00083 
00084             //set all the memrory to 0
00085             memset( gFileDataBase.pLibraries, 0, uiSize );
00086 
00087 
00088             //Load up each library
00089             for( i=0; i< NUMBER_OF_LIBRARIES; i++ )
00090             {
00091                   //if you want to init the library at the begining of the game
00092                   if( gGameLibaries[i].fInitOnStart )
00093                   {
00094                         //if the library exists
00095                         if( OpenLibrary( i ) )
00096                               fLibraryInited = TRUE;
00097 
00098                         //else the library doesnt exist
00099                         else
00100                         {
00101                               FastDebugMsg( String("Warning in InitializeFileDatabase( ): Library Id #%d (%s) is to be loaded but cannot be found.\n", i, gGameLibaries[i].sLibraryName ));
00102                               gFileDataBase.pLibraries[ i ].fLibraryOpen = FALSE;
00103                         }
00104                   }
00105             }
00106             //signify that the database has been initialized ( only if there was a library loaded )
00107             gFileDataBase.fInitialized = fLibraryInited;
00108       }
00109 
00110       //allocate memory for the handles of the 'real files' that will be open
00111       //This is needed because the the code wouldnt be able to tell the difference between a 'real' handle and a made up one
00112       uiSize = INITIAL_NUM_HANDLES * sizeof( RealFileOpenStruct );
00113       gFileDataBase.RealFiles.pRealFilesOpen = (RealFileOpenStruct *) MemAlloc( uiSize );
00114       CHECKF( gFileDataBase.RealFiles.pRealFilesOpen );
00115 
00116       //clear the memory
00117       memset( gFileDataBase.RealFiles.pRealFilesOpen, 0, uiSize);
00118 
00119       //set the initial number how many files can be opened at the one time
00120       gFileDataBase.RealFiles.iSizeOfOpenFileArray = INITIAL_NUM_HANDLES;
00121 
00122 
00123       return(TRUE);
00124 }

00127 //*****************************************************************************************
00128 // ReopenCDLibraries
00129 // 
00130 // Closes all CD libraries, then reopens them. This function needs to be called when CDs
00131 // are changed.
00132 // 
00133 // Returns BOOLEAN            - TRUE, always
00134 // 
00135 // Created:  3/21/00 Derek Beland
00136 //*****************************************************************************************
00137 BOOLEAN ReopenCDLibraries(void)
00138 {
00139 INT16 i;
00140 
00141       //Load up each library
00142       for(i=0; i < NUMBER_OF_LIBRARIES; i++ )
00143       {
00144             if(gFileDataBase.pLibraries[ i ].fLibraryOpen && gGameLibaries[i].fOnCDrom)
00145                   CloseLibrary(i);
00146 
00147             if(gGameLibaries[i].fOnCDrom)
00148                   OpenLibrary( i );
00149       }
00150 
00151       return(TRUE);
00152 }
00153 
00154 //************************************************************************
00155 //
00156 //     ShutDownFileDatabase():  Call this function to close down the file
00157 //    database.
00158 //
00159 //************************************************************************
00160 
00161 BOOLEAN ShutDownFileDatabase( )
00162 {
00163       UINT16 sLoop1;
00164 
00165       // Free up the memory used for each library
00166       for(sLoop1=0; sLoop1 < gFileDataBase.usNumberOfLibraries; sLoop1++)
00167             CloseLibrary( sLoop1 );
00168 
00169       //Free up the memory used for all the library headers
00170       if( gFileDataBase.pLibraries )
00171       {
00172             MemFree( gFileDataBase.pLibraries );
00173             gFileDataBase.pLibraries = NULL;
00174       }
00175 
00176 
00177       //loop through all the 'opened files' ( there should be no files open )
00178       for( sLoop1=0; sLoop1< gFileDataBase.RealFiles.iNumFilesOpen; sLoop1++)
00179       {
00180             FastDebugMsg( String("ShutDownFileDatabase( ):  ERROR:  real file id still exists, wasnt closed") );
00181             CloseHandle( gFileDataBase.RealFiles.pRealFilesOpen[ sLoop1 ].hRealFileHandle );
00182       }
00183 
00184       //Free up the memory used for the real files array for the opened files
00185       if( gFileDataBase.RealFiles.pRealFilesOpen )
00186       {
00187             MemFree( gFileDataBase.RealFiles.pRealFilesOpen );
00188             gFileDataBase.RealFiles.pRealFilesOpen = NULL;
00189       }
00190 
00191       return( TRUE );
00192 }

00197 BOOLEAN CheckForLibraryExistence( STR pLibraryName )
00198 {
00199       BOOLEAN fRetVal = FALSE;
00200       HANDLE      hFile;
00201 
00202       //try to opent the file, if we canm the library exists
00203       hFile = CreateFile( pLibraryName, GENERIC_READ, 0, NULL, OPEN_EXISTING, FILE_FLAG_RANDOM_ACCESS, NULL );
00204 
00205       //if the file was not opened
00206       if( hFile == INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE )
00207       {
00208 
00209             //the file wasnt opened
00210             fRetVal = FALSE;
00211       }
00212       else
00213       {
00214             CloseHandle( hFile );
00215             fRetVal = TRUE;
00216       }
00217 
00218       return( fRetVal );
00219 }

00224 BOOLEAN InitializeLibrary( STR pLibraryName, LibraryHeaderStruct *pLibHeader, BOOLEAN fCanBeOnCDrom )
00225 {
00226       HANDLE      hFile;
00227       UINT16      usNumEntries=0;
00228       UINT32      uiNumBytesRead;
00229       UINT32      uiLoop;
00230       DIRENTRY DirEntry;
00231       LIBHEADER   LibFileHeader;
00232       UINT32      uiCount=0;  
00233       CHAR8       zTempPath[ SGPFILENAME_LEN ];
00234 
00235       //open the library for reading ( if it exists )
00236       hFile = CreateFile( pLibraryName, GENERIC_READ, 0, NULL, OPEN_EXISTING, FILE_FLAG_RANDOM_ACCESS, NULL );
00237       if( hFile == INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE )
00238       {
00239             //if it failed finding the file on the hard drive, and the file can be on the cdrom
00240             if( fCanBeOnCDrom )
00241             {
00242                   // Add the path of the cdrom to the path of the library file
00243                   sprintf( zTempPath, "%s%s", gzCdDirectory, pLibraryName );
00244 
00245                   //look on the cdrom
00246                   hFile = CreateFile( zTempPath, GENERIC_READ, 0, NULL, OPEN_EXISTING, FILE_FLAG_RANDOM_ACCESS, NULL );
00247                   if( hFile == INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE )
00248                   {
00249                         UINT32 uiLastError = GetLastError();
00250                         char zString[1024];
00251                         FormatMessage( FORMAT_MESSAGE_FROM_SYSTEM, 0, uiLastError, 0, zString, 1024, NULL);
00252 
00253                         return( FALSE );
00254                   }
00255                   else
00256                         FastDebugMsg( String("CD Library %s opened.", zTempPath));
00257             }
00258             else
00259             {
00260                   //error opening the library
00261                   return(FALSE);
00262             }
00263       }
00264 
00265       // Read in the library header ( at the begining of the library )
00266       if( !ReadFile( hFile, &LibFileHeader, sizeof( LIBHEADER ), (LPDWORD) &uiNumBytesRead, NULL ) )
00267             return( FALSE );
00268 
00269       if( uiNumBytesRead != sizeof( LIBHEADER ) )
00270       {
00271             //Error Reading the file database header.
00272             return( FALSE );
00273       }
00274 
00275       //place the file pointer at the begining of the file headers ( they are at the end of the file )
00276       SetFilePointer( hFile, -( LibFileHeader.iEntries * (INT32)sizeof(DIRENTRY) ), NULL, FILE_END );
00277 
00278       //loop through the library and determine the number of files that are FILE_OK
00279       //ie.  so we dont load the old or deleted files
00280       usNumEntries = 0;
00281       for( uiLoop=0; uiLoop<(UINT32)LibFileHeader.iEntries; uiLoop++ )
00282       {
00283             //read in the file header
00284             if( !ReadFile( hFile, &DirEntry, sizeof( DIRENTRY ), (LPDWORD) &uiNumBytesRead, NULL ) )
00285                   return( FALSE );
00286 
00287             if( DirEntry.ubState == FILE_OK )
00288                   usNumEntries++;
00289       }
00290 
00291 
00292       //Allocate enough memory for the library header
00293       pLibHeader->pFileHeader = (FileHeaderStruct *) MemAlloc( sizeof( FileHeaderStruct ) * usNumEntries );
00294 
00295       #ifdef JA2TESTVERSION
00296             pLibHeader->uiTotalMemoryAllocatedForLibrary = sizeof( FileHeaderStruct ) * usNumEntries;
00297       #endif
00298 
00299 
00300       //place the file pointer at the begining of the file headers ( they are at the end of the file )
00301       SetFilePointer( hFile, -( LibFileHeader.iEntries * (INT32)sizeof(DIRENTRY) ), NULL, FILE_END );
00302 
00303       //loop through all the entries
00304       uiCount=0;
00305       for( uiLoop=0; uiLoop<(UINT32)LibFileHeader.iEntries; uiLoop++ )
00306       {
00307             //read in the file header
00308             if( !ReadFile( hFile, &DirEntry, sizeof( DIRENTRY ), (LPDWORD) &uiNumBytesRead, NULL ) )
00309                   return( FALSE );
00310 
00311 
00312             if( DirEntry.ubState == FILE_OK )
00313             {
00314                   //Check to see if the file is not longer then it should be
00315                   if( ( strlen( DirEntry.sFileName ) + 1 ) >= FILENAME_SIZE )
00316                         FastDebugMsg(String("\n*******InitializeLibrary():  Warning!:  '%s' from the library '%s' has name whose size (%d) is bigger then it should be (%s)", DirEntry.sFileName, pLibHeader->sLibraryPath, ( strlen( DirEntry.sFileName ) + 1 ), FILENAME_SIZE ) );
00317 
00318 
00319                   //allocate memory for the files name
00320                   pLibHeader->pFileHeader[ uiCount ].pFileName = (STR) MemAlloc( strlen( DirEntry.sFileName ) + 1 );
00321 
00322                   //if we couldnt allocate memory
00323                   if( !pLibHeader->pFileHeader[ uiCount ].pFileName )
00324                   {
00325                         //report an error
00326                         return(FALSE);
00327                   }
00328 
00329 
00330                   #ifdef JA2TESTVERSION
00331                         pLibHeader->uiTotalMemoryAllocatedForLibrary += strlen( DirEntry.sFileName ) + 1;
00332                   #endif
00333 
00334 
00335                   //copy the file name, offset and length into the header
00336                   strcpy( pLibHeader->pFileHeader[ uiCount ].pFileName, DirEntry.sFileName);
00337                   pLibHeader->pFileHeader[ uiCount ].uiFileOffset = DirEntry.uiOffset;
00338                   pLibHeader->pFileHeader[ uiCount ].uiFileLength = DirEntry.uiLength;
00339 
00340                   uiCount++;
00341             }
00342       }
00343 
00344 
00345       pLibHeader->usNumberOfEntries = usNumEntries;
00346 
00347       //allocate memory for the library path
00348 //    if( strlen( LibFileHeader.sPathToLibrary ) == 0 )
00349       {
00350 //          FastDebugMsg( String("The %s library file does not contain a path.  Use 'n' argument to name the library when you create it\n", LibFileHeader.sLibName ) );
00351 //          Assert( 0 );
00352       }
00353 
00354       //if the library has a path
00355       if( strlen( LibFileHeader.sPathToLibrary ) != 0 )
00356       {
00357             pLibHeader->sLibraryPath = (STR) MemAlloc( strlen( LibFileHeader.sPathToLibrary ) + 1 );
00358             strcpy( pLibHeader->sLibraryPath, LibFileHeader.sPathToLibrary );
00359       }
00360       else
00361       {
00362             //else the library name does not contain a path ( most likely either an error or it is the default path )
00363             pLibHeader->sLibraryPath = (STR) MemAlloc( 1 );
00364             pLibHeader->sLibraryPath[0] = '\0';
00365       }
00366 
00367 
00368       #ifdef JA2TESTVERSION
00369             pLibHeader->uiTotalMemoryAllocatedForLibrary += strlen( LibFileHeader.sPathToLibrary ) + 1;
00370       #endif
00371 
00372 
00373       //allocate space for the open files array
00374       pLibHeader->pOpenFiles = (FileOpenStruct *) MemAlloc( INITIAL_NUM_HANDLES * sizeof( FileOpenStruct ) );
00375       if( !pLibHeader->pOpenFiles )
00376       {
00377                   //report an error
00378                   return(FALSE);
00379       }
00380 
00381       memset( pLibHeader->pOpenFiles, 0, INITIAL_NUM_HANDLES * sizeof( FileOpenStruct ) );
00382 
00383       #ifdef JA2TESTVERSION
00384             pLibHeader->uiTotalMemoryAllocatedForLibrary += INITIAL_NUM_HANDLES * sizeof( FileOpenStruct );
00385       #endif
00386 
00387 
00388 
00389       pLibHeader->hLibraryHandle = hFile;
00390       pLibHeader->usNumberOfEntries = usNumEntries;
00391       pLibHeader->fLibraryOpen = TRUE;
00392       pLibHeader->iNumFilesOpen = 0;
00393       pLibHeader->iSizeOfOpenFileArray = INITIAL_NUM_HANDLES;
00394 
00395       return( TRUE );
00396 }

00401 BOOLEAN LoadDataFromLibrary( INT16 sLibraryID, UINT32 uiFileNum, PTR pData, UINT32 uiBytesToRead, UINT32 *pBytesRead )
00402 {
00403       UINT32      uiOffsetInLibrary, uiLength;
00404       HANDLE      hLibraryFile;
00405       UINT32      uiNumBytesRead;
00406       UINT32      uiCurPos;
00407 
00408 
00409       //get the offset into the library, the length and current position of the file pointer.
00410       uiOffsetInLibrary = gFileDataBase.pLibraries[ sLibraryID ].pOpenFiles[ uiFileNum ].pFileHeader->uiFileOffset;
00411       uiLength = gFileDataBase.pLibraries[ sLibraryID ].pOpenFiles[ uiFileNum ].pFileHeader->uiFileLength;
00412       hLibraryFile = gFileDataBase.pLibraries[ sLibraryID ].hLibraryHandle;
00413       uiCurPos = gFileDataBase.pLibraries[ sLibraryID ].pOpenFiles[ uiFileNum ].uiFilePosInFile;
00414 
00415 
00416       //set the file pointer to the right location
00417       SetFilePointer( hLibraryFile, ( uiOffsetInLibrary + uiCurPos ), NULL, FILE_BEGIN );
00418 
00419       //if we are trying to read more data then the size of the file, return an error
00420       if( uiBytesToRead + uiCurPos > uiLength )
00421       {
00422             *pBytesRead = 0;
00423             return( FALSE );
00424       }
00425 
00426       //get the data
00427       if( !ReadFile( hLibraryFile, pData, uiBytesToRead, (LPDWORD) &uiNumBytesRead, NULL ) )
00428             return( FALSE );
00429 
00430       if( uiBytesToRead != uiNumBytesRead )
00431       {
00432 //          Gets the reason why the function failed
00433 //          UINT32 uiLastError = GetLastError();
00434 //          char zString[1024];
00435 //          FormatMessage( FORMAT_MESSAGE_FROM_SYSTEM, 0, uiLastError, 0, zString, 1024, NULL);
00436 
00437             return( FALSE );
00438       }
00439 
00440       gFileDataBase.pLibraries[ sLibraryID ].pOpenFiles[ uiFileNum ].uiFilePosInFile += uiNumBytesRead;
00441 
00442       //    CloseHandle( hLibraryFile );
00443 
00444       *pBytesRead = uiNumBytesRead;
00445 
00446       return( TRUE );
00447 }

00449 //************************************************************************
00450 //
00451 // CheckIfFileExistInLibrary() determines if a file exists in a library.
00452 //
00453 //************************************************************************
00454 
00455 BOOLEAN CheckIfFileExistInLibrary( STR pFileName )
00456 {
00457       INT16 sLibraryID;
00458       FileHeaderStruct *pFileHeader;
00459 
00460       //get thelibrary that file is in
00461       sLibraryID = GetLibraryIDFromFileName( pFileName );
00462       if( sLibraryID == -1 )
00463       {
00464             //not in any library
00465             return( FALSE );
00466       }
00467 
00468       if( GetFileHeaderFromLibrary( sLibraryID, pFileName, &pFileHeader ) )
00469             return( TRUE );
00470       else
00471             return( FALSE );
00472 }

00474 
00475 //************************************************************************
00476 //
00477 //    This function finds out if the file CAN be in a library.  It determines
00478 //    if the library that the file MAY be in is open.
00479 //    ( eg. File is  Laptop\Test.sti, if the Laptop\ library is open, it returns true
00480 //
00481 //************************************************************************
00482 INT16 GetLibraryIDFromFileName( STR pFileName )
00483 {
00484 INT16 sLoop1, sBestMatch=-1;
00485 
00486       //loop through all the libraries to check which library the file is in
00487       for( sLoop1=0; sLoop1<gFileDataBase.usNumberOfLibraries; sLoop1++)
00488       {
00489             //if the library is not loaded, dont try to access the array
00490             if( IsLibraryOpened( sLoop1 ) )
00491             {
00492                   //if the library path name is of size zero, ( the library is for the default path )
00493                   if( strlen( gFileDataBase.pLibraries[ sLoop1 ].sLibraryPath ) == 0 )
00494                   {
00495                         //determine if there is a directory in the file name
00496                         if( strchr( pFileName, '\\' ) == NULL && strchr( pFileName, '//' ) == NULL )
00497                         {
00498                               //There is no directory in the file name
00499                               return( sLoop1 );
00500                         }
00501                   }
00502 
00503                   //compare the library name to the file name that is passed in
00504                   else 
00505                   {
00506                         // if the directory paths are the same, to the length of the lib's path
00507                         if( _strnicmp( gFileDataBase.pLibraries[ sLoop1 ].sLibraryPath, pFileName, strlen( gFileDataBase.pLibraries[ sLoop1 ].sLibraryPath ) ) == 0 )
00508                         {
00509                               // if we've never matched, or this match's path is longer than the previous match (meaning it's more exact)
00510                               if((sBestMatch==(-1)) || (strlen(gFileDataBase.pLibraries[ sLoop1 ].sLibraryPath) > strlen(gFileDataBase.pLibraries[ sBestMatch ].sLibraryPath)))
00511                                     sBestMatch = sLoop1;
00512                         }
00513                   }
00514             }
00515       }
00516 
00517       //no library was found, return an error
00518       return(sBestMatch);
00519 }
00520 
00521 
00522 //************************************************************************
00523 //
00524 //    GetFileHeaderFromLibrary() performsperforms a binary search of the
00525 //    library.  It adds the libraries path to the file in the
00526 //    library and then string compared that to the name that we are
00527 //    searching for.
00528 //
00529 //************************************************************************
00530 
00531 BOOLEAN     GetFileHeaderFromLibrary( INT16 sLibraryID, STR pstrFileName, FileHeaderStruct **pFileHeader )
00532 {
00533       FileHeaderStruct **ppFileHeader;
00534       CHAR8       sFileNameWithPath[ FILENAME_SIZE ];
00535 
00536       //combine the library path to the file name (need it for the search of the library )
00537       strcpy( sFileNameWithPath, pstrFileName);
00538 
00539       gsCurrentLibrary = sLibraryID;
00540 
00541        /* try to find the filename using a binary search algorithm: */
00542        ppFileHeader = (FileHeaderStruct **) bsearch( (char *) &sFileNameWithPath, (FileHeaderStruct *) gFileDataBase.pLibraries[ sLibraryID ].pFileHeader, gFileDataBase.pLibraries[ sLibraryID ].usNumberOfEntries,
00543                                                                                           sizeof( FileHeaderStruct ), (int (*)(const void*, const void*))CompareFileNames );
00544 
00545        if( ppFileHeader )
00546        {
00547                   *pFileHeader = ( FileHeaderStruct * ) ppFileHeader;
00548                   return( TRUE );
00549        }
00550        else
00551        {
00552                   pFileHeader = NULL;
00553                   return( FALSE );
00554        }
00555 }
00556 
00557 
00558 //************************************************************************
00559 //
00560 //    CompareFileNames() gets called by the binary search function.
00561 //
00562 //************************************************************************
00563 
00564 INT CompareFileNames( CHAR8 *arg1[], FileHeaderStruct **arg2 )
00565 {
00566       CHAR8       sSearchKey[ FILENAME_SIZE ];
00567       CHAR8       sFileNameWithPath[ FILENAME_SIZE ];
00568       FileHeaderStruct *TempFileHeader;
00569 
00570       TempFileHeader = ( FileHeaderStruct * ) arg2;
00571 
00572       sprintf( sSearchKey, "%s", arg1);
00573 
00574       sprintf( sFileNameWithPath, "%s%s", gFileDataBase.pLibraries[ gsCurrentLibrary ].sLibraryPath, TempFileHeader->pFileName );
00575 
00576    /* Compare all of both strings: */
00577    return _stricmp( sSearchKey, sFileNameWithPath );
00578 }

00582 
00583 void AddSlashToPath( STR pName )
00584 {
00585       UINT32      uiLoop, uiCounter;
00586       BOOLEAN     fDone = FALSE;
00587       BOOLEAN fFound = FALSE;
00588       CHAR8       sNewName[ FILENAME_SIZE ];
00589 
00590       //find out if there is a '\' in the file name
00591 
00592       uiCounter=0;
00593       for( uiLoop=0; uiLoop < strlen( pName ) && !fDone; uiLoop++)
00594       {
00595             if( pName[ uiLoop ] == '\\' )
00596             {
00597                   sNewName[ uiCounter ] = pName[ uiLoop ];
00598                   uiCounter++;
00599                   sNewName[ uiCounter ] = '\\';
00600             }
00601             else
00602                   sNewName[ uiCounter ] = pName[ uiLoop ];
00603 
00604             uiCounter++;
00605       }
00606       sNewName[ uiCounter ] = '\0';
00607 
00608       strcpy( pName, sNewName );
00609 }

00612 
00613 //************************************************************************
00614 //
00615 // This function will see if a file is in a library.  If it is, the file will be opened and a file
00616 // handle will be created for it.
00617 //
00618 //************************************************************************
00619 
00620 HWFILE OpenFileFromLibrary( STR pName )
00621 {
00622       FileHeaderStruct *pFileHeader;
00623       HWFILE                              hLibFile;
00624       INT16                                     sLibraryID;
00625       UINT16                                    uiLoop1;
00626       UINT32                                    uiFileNum=0;
00627 
00628       UINT32                                    uiNewFilePosition=0;
00629 
00630 
00631       //Check if the file can be contained from an open library ( the path to the file a library path )
00632       sLibraryID = GetLibraryIDFromFileName( pName );
00633 
00634       if( sLibraryID != -1 )
00635       {
00636             //Check if another file is already open in the library ( report a warning if so )
00637 
00638 //          if( gFileDataBase.pLibraries[ sLibraryID ].fAnotherFileAlreadyOpenedLibrary )
00639             if( gFileDataBase.pLibraries[ sLibraryID ].uiIdOfOtherFileAlreadyOpenedLibrary != 0 )
00640             {
00641                   // Temp removed
00642 //                FastDebugMsg(String("\n*******\nOpenFileFromLibrary():  Warning!:  Trying to load file '%s' from the library '%s' which already has a file open\n", pName, gGameLibaries[ sLibraryID ].sLibraryName ) );
00643 //                FastDebugMsg(String("\n*******\nOpenFileFromLibrary():  Warning!:  Trying to load file '%s' from the library '%s' which already has a file open ( file open is '%s')\n", pName, gGameLibaries[ sLibraryID ].sLibraryName, gFileDataBase.pLibraries[ sLibraryID ].pOpenFiles[ gFileDataBase.pLibraries[ sLibraryID ].uiIdOfOtherFileAlreadyOpenedLibrary ].pFileHeader->pFileName ) );
00644             }
00645 
00646             //check if the file is already open
00647             if( CheckIfFileIsAlreadyOpen( pName, sLibraryID ) )
00648                   return( 0 );
00649 
00650             //if the file is in a library, get the file
00651             if( GetFileHeaderFromLibrary( sLibraryID, pName, &pFileHeader ) )
00652             {
00653                   //increment the number of open files
00654                   gFileDataBase.pLibraries[ sLibraryID ].iNumFilesOpen ++;
00655 
00656                   //if there isnt enough space to put the file, realloc more space
00657                   if( gFileDataBase.pLibraries[ sLibraryID ].iNumFilesOpen >= gFileDataBase.pLibraries[ sLibraryID ].iSizeOfOpenFileArray )
00658                   {
00659                         FileOpenStruct    *pOpenFiles;
00660 
00661                         //reallocate more space for the array
00662                         pOpenFiles = (FileOpenStruct *) MemRealloc( gFileDataBase.pLibraries[ sLibraryID ].pOpenFiles,
00663                                                  gFileDataBase.pLibraries[ sLibraryID ].iSizeOfOpenFileArray + NUM_FILES_TO_ADD_AT_A_TIME );
00664 
00665                         if( !pOpenFiles )
00666                               return( 0 );
00667 
00668                         //increment the number of open files that we can have open
00669                         gFileDataBase.pLibraries[ sLibraryID ].iSizeOfOpenFileArray += NUM_FILES_TO_ADD_AT_A_TIME;
00670 
00671 
00672                         gFileDataBase.pLibraries[ sLibraryID ].pOpenFiles = pOpenFiles;
00673                   }
00674 
00675                   //loop through to find a new spot in the array
00676                   uiFileNum = 0;
00677                   for( uiLoop1=1; uiLoop1 < gFileDataBase.pLibraries[ sLibraryID ].iSizeOfOpenFileArray; uiLoop1++)
00678                   {
00679                         if( gFileDataBase.pLibraries[ sLibraryID ].pOpenFiles[ uiLoop1 ].uiFileID == 0 )
00680                         {
00681                               uiFileNum = uiLoop1;
00682                               break;
00683                         }
00684                   }
00685 
00686                   //if for some reason we couldnt find a spot, return an error
00687                   if( uiFileNum == 0 )
00688                         return( 0 );
00689 
00690                   //Create a library handle for the new file
00691                   hLibFile = CreateLibraryFileHandle( sLibraryID, uiFileNum );
00692 
00693                   //Set the current file data into the array of open files
00694                   gFileDataBase.pLibraries[ sLibraryID ].pOpenFiles[ uiFileNum ].uiFileID = hLibFile;
00695                   gFileDataBase.pLibraries[ sLibraryID ].pOpenFiles[ uiFileNum ].uiFilePosInFile = 0;
00696                   gFileDataBase.pLibraries[ sLibraryID ].pOpenFiles[ uiFileNum ].pFileHeader = pFileHeader;
00697 
00698                   //Save the current file position in the library
00699                   gFileDataBase.pLibraries[ sLibraryID ].pOpenFiles[ uiFileNum ].uiActualPositionInLibrary = SetFilePointer( gFileDataBase.pLibraries[ sLibraryID ].hLibraryHandle, 0, NULL, FILE_CURRENT );
00700 
00701                   //Set the file position in the library to the begining of the 'file' in the library
00702                   uiNewFilePosition = SetFilePointer( gFileDataBase.pLibraries[ sLibraryID ].hLibraryHandle, gFileDataBase.pLibraries[ sLibraryID ].pOpenFiles[ uiFileNum ].pFileHeader->uiFileOffset, NULL, FILE_BEGIN );
00703 
00704                   uiNewFilePosition = GetFileSize( gFileDataBase.pLibraries[ sLibraryID ].hLibraryHandle, NULL );
00705 
00706             }
00707             else
00708             {
00709                   // Failed to find the file in a library
00710                   return( 0 );
00711             }
00712       }
00713       else
00714       {
00715             // Library is not open, or doesnt exist
00716             return( 0 );
00717       }
00718 
00719       //Set the fact the a file is currently open in the library
00720 //    gFileDataBase.pLibraries[ sLibraryID ].fAnotherFileAlreadyOpenedLibrary = TRUE;
00721       gFileDataBase.pLibraries[ sLibraryID ].uiIdOfOtherFileAlreadyOpenedLibrary = uiFileNum;
00722 
00723       return( hLibFile );
00724 }
00725

00728 
00729 HWFILE CreateLibraryFileHandle( INT16 sLibraryID, UINT32 uiFileNum )
00730 {
00731       HWFILE hLibFile;
00732 
00733 
00734       hLibFile = uiFileNum;
00735       hLibFile |= DB_ADD_LIBRARY_ID( sLibraryID );
00736 
00737       return( hLibFile );
00738 }
00739 
00740 
00741 HWFILE CreateRealFileHandle( HANDLE hFile )
00742 {
00743       HWFILE hLibFile;
00744       INT32 iLoop1;
00745       UINT32      uiFileNum=0;
00746       UINT32 uiSize;
00747 
00748       //if there isnt enough space to put the file, realloc more space
00749       if( gFileDataBase.RealFiles.iNumFilesOpen >= ( gFileDataBase.RealFiles.iSizeOfOpenFileArray -1 ) )
00750       {
00751             uiSize = ( gFileDataBase.RealFiles.iSizeOfOpenFileArray + NUM_FILES_TO_ADD_AT_A_TIME ) * sizeof( RealFileOpenStruct );
00752 
00753             gFileDataBase.RealFiles.pRealFilesOpen = (RealFileOpenStruct *) MemRealloc( gFileDataBase.RealFiles.pRealFilesOpen, uiSize );
00754             CHECKF( gFileDataBase.RealFiles.pRealFilesOpen );
00755 
00756             //Clear out the new part of the array
00757             memset( &gFileDataBase.RealFiles.pRealFilesOpen[ gFileDataBase.RealFiles.iSizeOfOpenFileArray ], 0, ( NUM_FILES_TO_ADD_AT_A_TIME * sizeof( RealFileOpenStruct ) ) );
00758 
00759             gFileDataBase.RealFiles.iSizeOfOpenFileArray += NUM_FILES_TO_ADD_AT_A_TIME;
00760       }
00761 
00762 
00763       //loop through to find a new spot in the array
00764       uiFileNum = 0;
00765       for( iLoop1=1; iLoop1 < gFileDataBase.RealFiles.iSizeOfOpenFileArray; iLoop1++)
00766       {
00767             if( gFileDataBase.RealFiles.pRealFilesOpen[ iLoop1 ].uiFileID == 0 )
00768             {
00769                   uiFileNum = iLoop1;
00770                   break;
00771             }
00772       }
00773 
00774       //if for some reason we couldnt find a spot, return an error
00775       if( uiFileNum == 0 )
00776             return( 0 );
00777 
00778       hLibFile = uiFileNum;
00779       hLibFile |= DB_ADD_LIBRARY_ID( REAL_FILE_LIBRARY_ID );
00780 
00781       gFileDataBase.RealFiles.pRealFilesOpen[ iLoop1 ].uiFileID = hLibFile;
00782       gFileDataBase.RealFiles.pRealFilesOpen[ iLoop1 ].hRealFileHandle = hFile;
00783 
00784       gFileDataBase.RealFiles.iNumFilesOpen++;
00785 
00786       return( hLibFile );
00787 }

00800             int q=5;
00801       }
00802 */
00803       return( TRUE );

00807 //************************************************************************
00808 //
00809 //    Close an individual file that is contained in the library
00810 //
00811 //************************************************************************
00812 
00813 
00814 
00815 BOOLEAN CloseLibraryFile( INT16 sLibraryID, UINT32 uiFileID )
00816 {
00817       if( IsLibraryOpened( sLibraryID ) )
00818       {
00819             //if the uiFileID is invalid
00820             if( (uiFileID >= (UINT32)gFileDataBase.pLibraries[ sLibraryID ].iSizeOfOpenFileArray ) )
00821                   return( FALSE );
00822                   
00823             //if the file is not opened, dont close it
00824             if( gFileDataBase.pLibraries[ sLibraryID ].pOpenFiles[ uiFileID ].uiFileID != 0 )
00825             {
00826                   //reset the variables
00827                   gFileDataBase.pLibraries[ sLibraryID ].pOpenFiles[ uiFileID ].uiFileID = 0;
00828                   gFileDataBase.pLibraries[ sLibraryID ].pOpenFiles[ uiFileID ].uiFilePosInFile = 0;
00829                   gFileDataBase.pLibraries[ sLibraryID ].pOpenFiles[ uiFileID ].pFileHeader = NULL;
00830 
00831                   //reset the libraries file pointer to the positon it was in prior to opening the current file
00832                   SetFilePointer( gFileDataBase.pLibraries[ sLibraryID ].hLibraryHandle, gFileDataBase.pLibraries[ sLibraryID ].pOpenFiles[ uiFileID ].uiActualPositionInLibrary, NULL, FILE_CURRENT);
00833 
00834                   //decrement the number of files that are open
00835                   gFileDataBase.pLibraries[ sLibraryID ].iNumFilesOpen--;
00836 
00837                   // Reset the fact that a file is accessing the library
00838 //                gFileDataBase.pLibraries[ sLibraryID ].fAnotherFileAlreadyOpenedLibrary = FALSE;
00839                   gFileDataBase.pLibraries[ sLibraryID ].uiIdOfOtherFileAlreadyOpenedLibrary = 0;
00840             }
00841       }
00842 
00843       return( TRUE );
00844 }
00845 
00846 
00847 BOOLEAN LibraryFileSeek( INT16 sLibraryID, UINT32 uiFileNum, UINT32 uiDistance, UINT8 uiHowToSeek )
00848 {
00849       UINT32      uiCurPos, uiSize;
00850 
00851       //if the library is not open, return an error
00852       if( !IsLibraryOpened( sLibraryID ) )
00853             return( FALSE );
00854 
00855       uiCurPos = gFileDataBase.pLibraries[ sLibraryID ].pOpenFiles[ uiFileNum ].uiFilePosInFile;
00856       uiSize = gFileDataBase.pLibraries[ sLibraryID ].pOpenFiles[ uiFileNum ].pFileHeader->uiFileLength;
00857 
00858 
00859       if ( uiHowToSeek == FILE_SEEK_FROM_START )
00860             uiCurPos = uiDistance;
00861       else if ( uiHowToSeek == FILE_SEEK_FROM_END )
00862             uiCurPos = uiSize - uiDistance;
00863       else if ( uiHowToSeek == FILE_SEEK_FROM_CURRENT )
00864             uiCurPos += uiDistance;
00865       else
00866             return(FALSE);
00867 
00868       gFileDataBase.pLibraries[ sLibraryID ].pOpenFiles[ uiFileNum ].uiFilePosInFile = uiCurPos;
00869       return( TRUE );
00870 }

00875 //************************************************************************
00876 //
00877 //    OpenLibrary() Opens a library from the 'array' of library names
00878 //    that was passd in at game initialization.  Pass in an enum for the
00879 //    library.
00880 //
00881 //************************************************************************
00882 
00883 BOOLEAN OpenLibrary( INT16 sLibraryID )
00884 {
00885       //if the library is already opened, report an error
00886       if( gFileDataBase.pLibraries[ sLibraryID ].fLibraryOpen )
00887             return( FALSE );
00888 
00889       //if we are trying to do something with an invalid library id
00890       if( sLibraryID >= gFileDataBase.usNumberOfLibraries )
00891             return( FALSE );
00892 
00893 
00894       //if we cant open the library
00895       if( !InitializeLibrary( gGameLibaries[ sLibraryID ].sLibraryName, &gFileDataBase.pLibraries[ sLibraryID ], gGameLibaries[ sLibraryID ].fOnCDrom ) )
00896             return( FALSE );
00897 
00898       return( TRUE );
00899 }
00900 
00901 
00902 
00903 
00904 BOOLEAN CloseLibrary( INT16 sLibraryID )
00905 {
00906       UINT32      uiLoop1;
00907 
00908       //if the library isnt loaded, dont close it
00909       if( !IsLibraryOpened( sLibraryID ) )
00910             return( FALSE );
00911 
00912       #ifdef JA2TESTVERSION
00913             FastDebugMsg( String("ShutDownFileDatabase( ): %d bytes of ram used for the Library #%3d, path '%s',  in the File Database System\n", gFileDataBase.pLibraries[ sLibraryID ].uiTotalMemoryAllocatedForLibrary, sLibraryID, gFileDataBase.pLibraries[ sLibraryID ].sLibraryPath ));
00914             gFileDataBase.pLibraries[ sLibraryID ].uiTotalMemoryAllocatedForLibrary = 0;
00915       #endif
00916 
00917       //if there are any open files, loop through the library and close down whatever file is still open
00918       if( gFileDataBase.pLibraries[ sLibraryID ].iNumFilesOpen )
00919       {
00920             //loop though the array of open files to see if any are still open
00921             for( uiLoop1=0; uiLoop1<( UINT32 )gFileDataBase.pLibraries[ sLibraryID ].usNumberOfEntries; uiLoop1++)
00922             {
00923                   if( CheckIfFileIsAlreadyOpen( gFileDataBase.pLibraries[ sLibraryID ].pFileHeader[ uiLoop1 ].pFileName, sLibraryID ) )
00924                   {
00925                         FastDebugMsg( String("CloseLibrary():  ERROR:  %s library file id still exists, wasnt closed, closing now.", gFileDataBase.pLibraries[ sLibraryID ].pFileHeader[ uiLoop1 ].pFileName ) );
00926                         CloseLibraryFile( sLibraryID, uiLoop1 );
00927 
00928                         //    Removed because the memory gets freed in the next for loop.  Would only enter here if files were still open
00929                         //    gFileDataBase.pLibraries[ sLibraryID ].pFileHeader[ uiLoop1 ].pFileName = NULL;
00930                   }
00931             }
00932       }
00933 
00934       //Free up the memory used for each file name
00935       for( uiLoop1=0; uiLoop1<gFileDataBase.pLibraries[ sLibraryID ].usNumberOfEntries; uiLoop1++)
00936       {
00937             MemFree( gFileDataBase.pLibraries[ sLibraryID ].pFileHeader[ uiLoop1 ].pFileName );
00938             gFileDataBase.pLibraries[ sLibraryID ].pFileHeader[ uiLoop1 ].pFileName = NULL;
00939       }
00940 
00941       //Free up the memory needed for the Library File Headers
00942       if( gFileDataBase.pLibraries[ sLibraryID ].pFileHeader )
00943       {
00944             MemFree( gFileDataBase.pLibraries[ sLibraryID ].pFileHeader );
00945             gFileDataBase.pLibraries[ sLibraryID ].pFileHeader = NULL;
00946       }
00947 
00948       //Free up the memory used for the library name
00949       if( gFileDataBase.pLibraries[ sLibraryID ].sLibraryPath )
00950       {
00951             MemFree( gFileDataBase.pLibraries[ sLibraryID ].sLibraryPath );
00952             gFileDataBase.pLibraries[ sLibraryID ].sLibraryPath = NULL;
00953       }
00954 
00955       //Free up the space requiered for the open files array
00956       if( gFileDataBase.pLibraries[ sLibraryID ].pOpenFiles )
00957       {
00958             MemFree( gFileDataBase.pLibraries[ sLibraryID ].pOpenFiles );
00959             gFileDataBase.pLibraries[ sLibraryID ].pOpenFiles = NULL;
00960       }
00961 
00962       //set that the library isnt open
00963       gFileDataBase.pLibraries[ sLibraryID ].fLibraryOpen = FALSE;
00964 
00965       //close the file ( note libraries are to be closed by the Windows close function )
00966       CloseHandle( gFileDataBase.pLibraries[ sLibraryID ].hLibraryHandle );
00967 
00968 
00969 
00970       return( TRUE );
00971 }
00972 
00973 BOOLEAN IsLibraryOpened( INT16 sLibraryID )
00974 {
00975       //if the database is not initialized
00976       if( !gFileDataBase.fInitialized )
00977             return( FALSE );
00978 
00979       //if we are trying to do something with an invalid library id
00980       if( sLibraryID >= gFileDataBase.usNumberOfLibraries )
00981             return( FALSE );
00982 
00983       //if the library is opened
00984       if( gFileDataBase.pLibraries[ sLibraryID ].fLibraryOpen )
00985             return( TRUE );
00986       else
00987             return( FALSE );
00988 }
00989 
00990 
00991 
00992 
00993 BOOLEAN CheckIfFileIsAlreadyOpen( STR pFileName, INT16 sLibraryID )
00994 {
00995       UINT16 usLoop1=0;
00996 
00997       CHAR8 sName[ 60 ];
00998       CHAR8 sPath[ 90 ];
00999       CHAR8 sDrive[ 60 ];
01000       CHAR8 sExt[ 6 ];
01001 
01002       CHAR8 sTempName[ 70 ];
01003 
01004       _splitpath( pFileName, sDrive, sPath, sName, sExt);
01005 
01006       strcpy( sTempName, sName );
01007       strcat( sTempName, sExt );
01008 
01009       //loop through all the open files to see if 'new' file to open is already open
01010       for( usLoop1=1; usLoop1 < gFileDataBase.pLibraries[ sLibraryID ].iSizeOfOpenFileArray ; usLoop1++ )
01011       {
01012             //check if the file is open
01013             if( gFileDataBase.pLibraries[ sLibraryID ].pOpenFiles[ usLoop1].uiFileID != 0 )
01014             {
01015                   //Check if the file already exists
01016                   if( _stricmp( sTempName, gFileDataBase.pLibraries[ sLibraryID ].pOpenFiles[ usLoop1].pFileHeader->pFileName ) == 0 )
01017                         return( TRUE );
01018             }
01019       }
01020       return( FALSE );
01021 }
01022 
01023 
01024 BOOLEAN GetLibraryFileTime( INT16 sLibraryID, UINT32 uiFileNum, SGP_FILETIME  *pLastWriteTime )
01025 {
01026       UINT16      usNumEntries=0;
01027       UINT32      uiNumBytesRead;
01028       DIRENTRY *pDirEntry;
01029       LIBHEADER   LibFileHeader;
01030       BOOLEAN fDone = FALSE;
01031 //    UINT32      cnt;
01032       INT32 iFilePos=0;
01033 
01034       DIRENTRY **ppDirEntry;
01035 
01036       DIRENTRY *pAllEntries;
01037 
01038 
01039       memset( pLastWriteTime, 0, sizeof( SGP_FILETIME ) );
01040 
01041       SetFilePointer( gFileDataBase.pLibraries[ sLibraryID ].hLibraryHandle, 0, NULL, FILE_BEGIN );
01042 
01043       // Read in the library header ( at the begining of the library )
01044       if( !ReadFile( gFileDataBase.pLibraries[ sLibraryID ].hLibraryHandle, &LibFileHeader, sizeof( LIBHEADER ), (LPDWORD) &uiNumBytesRead, NULL ) )
01045             return( FALSE );
01046       if( uiNumBytesRead != sizeof( LIBHEADER ) )
01047       {
01048             //Error Reading the file database header.
01049             return( FALSE );
01050       }
01051 
01052 
01053       //If the file number is greater then the number in the lirary, return false
01054       if( uiFileNum >= (UINT32)LibFileHeader.iEntries )
01055             return( FALSE );
01056 
01057       pAllEntries = (DIRENTRY *) MemAlloc( sizeof( DIRENTRY ) * LibFileHeader.iEntries );
01058       if( pAllEntries == NULL )
01059             return( FALSE );
01060       memset( pAllEntries, 0, sizeof( DIRENTRY ) );
01061 
01062 
01063 
01064       iFilePos = -( LibFileHeader.iEntries * (INT32)sizeof(DIRENTRY) );
01065 
01066       //set the file pointer to the right location
01067       SetFilePointer( gFileDataBase.pLibraries[ sLibraryID ].hLibraryHandle, iFilePos, NULL, FILE_END );
01068 
01069       // Read in the library header ( at the begining of the library )
01070       if( !ReadFile( gFileDataBase.pLibraries[ sLibraryID ].hLibraryHandle, pAllEntries, ( sizeof( DIRENTRY ) * LibFileHeader.iEntries ), (LPDWORD) &uiNumBytesRead, NULL ) )
01071             return( FALSE );
01072       if( uiNumBytesRead != ( sizeof( DIRENTRY ) * LibFileHeader.iEntries ) )
01073       {
01074             //Error Reading the file database header.
01075             return( FALSE );
01076       }
01077 
01078 
01079 
01080        /* try to find the filename using a binary search algorithm: */
01081        ppDirEntry = (DIRENTRY **) bsearch( gFileDataBase.pLibraries[ sLibraryID ].pOpenFiles[ uiFileNum ].pFileHeader->pFileName, 
01082                                                                                                                   (DIRENTRY *) pAllEntries, 
01083                                                                                                                   LibFileHeader.iEntries,
01084                                                                                                                   sizeof( DIRENTRY ), (int (*)(const void*, const void*))CompareDirEntryFileNames );
01085 
01086        if( ppDirEntry )
01087             pDirEntry = ( DIRENTRY * ) ppDirEntry;
01088        else
01089             return( FALSE );
01090 
01091       //Copy the dir entry time over to the passed in time
01092       memcpy( pLastWriteTime, &pDirEntry->sFileTime, sizeof( SGP_FILETIME ) );
01093 
01094 
01095       MemFree( pAllEntries );
01096       pAllEntries = NULL;
01097 
01098       return( TRUE );
01099 }
01100 
01101 
01102 
01103 //************************************************************************
01104 //
01105 //    CompareFileNames() gets called by the binary search function.
01106 //
01107 //************************************************************************
01108 
01109 INT32 CompareDirEntryFileNames( CHAR8 *arg1[], DIRENTRY **arg2 )
01110 {
01111       CHAR8                   sSearchKey[ FILENAME_SIZE ];
01112       CHAR8                   sFileNameWithPath[ FILENAME_SIZE ];
01113       DIRENTRY          *TempDirEntry;
01114 
01115       TempDirEntry = ( DIRENTRY * ) arg2;
01116 
01117       sprintf( sSearchKey, "%s", arg1);
01118 
01119       sprintf( sFileNameWithPath, "%s", TempDirEntry->sFileName );
01120 
01121    /* Compare all of both strings: */
01122    return _stricmp( sSearchKey, sFileNameWithPath );
01123 }
